Package com.oopsipushedtomain.Database

Class FirebaseAccess

java.lang.Object
com.oopsipushedtomain.Database.FirebaseAccess
public class FirebaseAccess extends Object
Class for all Firebase accesses Has methods for accessing both storage and Firestore database Methods will return futures, use .thenAccept or .thenApply to handle the output!!!
See Also:
  • FirebaseInnerCollection
  • FirestoreAccessType
  • ImageType

      Parameters:

      innerCollName - The inner collection

      Returns:
      The completable future

    • storeDataInFirestore

      public Map<String,Object> storeDataInFirestore(String docName, Map<String,Object> data)
      Stores data in Firestore, given the UID of the document. If it is a new document, it will create a UID Assumes the document is an outer document
      Parameters:
      docName - The UID of the document to write to
      data - The data to write to the document
      Returns:
      A map containing the UID of the outer document Map.get("outer")

    • storeDataInFirestore

      public Map<String,Object> storeDataInFirestore(String outerDocName, FirebaseInnerCollection innerCollName, String innerDocName, Map<String,Object> data)
      Stores data in Firestore, given the UID of the document and inner collection/document if needed If the inner document or collection are null, the data is stored in the outer document If the outer doc name is not given, make a new one
      Parameters:
      outerDocName - The UID of the outer document (Ex. Event UID)
      innerCollName - The name of the inner collection, if null, store in outer document
      innerDocName - The UID of the inner document (Ex. eventPosters), if null, store in outer document
      data - The data to write to the inner document
      Returns:
      A map containing the UID of the outer document Map.get("outer") and the UID of the inner document Map.get("inner")

    • storeImageInFirestore

      public String storeImageInFirestore(String attachedTo, String imageUID, ImageType imageType, android.graphics.Bitmap image)
      Saves an image to firestore and creates a link to it
      Parameters:
      attachedTo - The UID/name of the document this image is linked to. Ex: USER-0000000000
      imageUID - The UID/name of the image (will create new if null)
      imageType - The type of image you are uploading (only used for events)
      image - The image to upload
      Returns:
      The UID of the image or null if there was an error

    • storeImageInFirestore

      public String storeImageInFirestore(String attachedTo, String imageUID, ImageType imageType, android.graphics.Bitmap image, Map<String,Object> imageData)
      Saves an image to firestore and creates a link to it Also allows for attaching extra data to the image
      Parameters:
      attachedTo - The UID/name of the document this image is linked to. Ex: USER-0000000000
      imageUID - The UID/name of the image (will create new if null)
      imageType - The type of image you are uploading (only used for events)
      image - The image to upload
      imageData - Any other data to add to the image
      Returns:
      The UID of the image or null if there was an error

    • getDataFromFirestore

      public CompletableFuture<Map<String,Object>> getDataFromFirestore(String docName)
      Gets the data from a document and returns it as a map Assumes there is only one document to return Assumes the given document is an outer document
      Parameters:
      docName - The UID of the document in the outer collection.
      Returns:
      The data in the document, or null if the document was not found

    • getDataFromFirestore

      public CompletableFuture<Map<String,Object>> getDataFromFirestore(String outerDocName, FirebaseInnerCollection innerCollName, String innerDocName)
      Gets the data from a document and returns it as a map Assumes there is only one document to return
      Parameters:
      outerDocName - The UID of the document in the outer collection. If the other inputs are null, will return data from this document
      innerCollName - The name of the inner collection. If this is null, will return data from the outer collection
      innerDocName - The UID of the document in the inner collection. If this is null, will return data from the outer collection
      Returns:
      The data in the document, or null if the document was not found

    • getImageFromFirestore

      public CompletableFuture<Map<String,Object>> getImageFromFirestore(String imageUID, ImageType imageType)
      Gets an image from Firestore
      Parameters:
      imageUID - The UID of the image
      imageType - The type of the image
      Returns:
      A map containing the image and it's data

    • deleteDataFromFirestore

      public CompletableFuture<Void> deleteDataFromFirestore(String docName)
      Deletes a document from Firestore Deletes all inner collections before deleting the outer document Assumes the document UID entered is a outer document Assumes any linked objects were already deleted
      Parameters:
      docName - The UID of the outer document to delete

    • deleteDataFromFirestore

      public CompletableFuture<Void> deleteDataFromFirestore(String outerDocName, FirebaseInnerCollection innerCollName, String innerDocName)
      Deletes a document from Firestore. Deletes all inner collections before deleting the outer document
      Parameters:
      outerDocName - The UID of the document in the outer collection. If the other inputs are null, will delete this document
      innerCollName - The name of the inner collection. If this is null, will delete outer document
      innerDocName - The UID of the document in the inner collection. If this is null, will delete outer document

    • deleteDocumentFromFirestore

      private CompletableFuture<Void> deleteDocumentFromFirestore(com.google.firebase.firestore.DocumentReference ref)
      Deletes a single document from Firestore
      Parameters:
      ref - A reference to the document to delete

    • getAllDocuments

      public CompletableFuture<ArrayList<Map<String,Object>>> getAllDocuments()
      Gets the data of all documents in a collection Assumes the collection is the main collection
      Returns:
      The list of document data

    • getAllDocuments

      public CompletableFuture<ArrayList<Map<String,Object>>> getAllDocuments(String outerDocName, FirebaseInnerCollection innerCollName)
      Gets the list of the data of all documents in a collection
      Parameters:
      outerDocName - The UID of the document containing the inner collection, if null gets the data from the main collection
      innerCollName - The name of the inner collection, if null gets the data from the main collection
      Returns:
      The list of document data

    • deleteImageFromFirestore

      public CompletableFuture<Void> deleteImageFromFirestore(String outerDocName, String imageUID, ImageType imageType)
      Deletes an image from Firestore The reference to the image is also removed from its origin The image link is also deleted
      Parameters:
      imageUID - The UID of the image to delete
      imageType - The type of image (Ex. promoQRCCode)
      outerDocName - The outer document name
      Returns:
      A future for the delete

    • getAllRelatedImagesFromFirestore

      public CompletableFuture<ArrayList<Map<String,Object>>> getAllRelatedImagesFromFirestore(String outerDocName, ImageType imageType)
      Gets all the images contained in a Firestore inner collection
      Parameters:
      outerDocName - The UID of the document containing the inner collection, if null gets the data from the main collection
      imageType - The the type of image you want to retrieve, if null gets the data from the main collection
      Returns:
      The list of images and UIDs as a Map, or null if no images were found

    • getAllImagesFromFirestore

      public CompletableFuture<ArrayList<Map<String,Object>>> getAllImagesFromFirestore(ImageType imageType)
      Gets all the images of a specific type from Firestore
      Parameters:
      imageType - The type of images to get
      Returns:
      The list of images and UIDs as a Map, or null if no images were found

    • getDataWithFieldEqualTo

      public CompletableFuture<ArrayList<Map<String,Object>>> getDataWithFieldEqualTo(String fieldName, String fieldData)
      Gets any documents matching the given field from an outer collection
      Parameters:
      fieldName - The name of the field
      fieldData - The data inside the field
      Returns:
      A completable future containing the data

    • getDataWithFieldEqualTo

      public CompletableFuture<ArrayList<Map<String,Object>>> getDataWithFieldEqualTo(String outerDocName, FirebaseInnerCollection innerCollName, String innerDocName, String fieldName, String fieldData)
      Gets any documents matching the given field
      Parameters:
      outerDocName - The name of the outer document
      innerCollName - The name of the inner collection
      innerDocName - The name of the inner document
      fieldName - The name of the field
      fieldData - The data inside the field
      Returns:
      A completable future containing the data

    • deleteAllDataInFirestore

      public CompletableFuture<Void> deleteAllDataInFirestore()
      This function is callable from any access DELETES ALL DOCUMENTS ACROSS ALL COLLECTIONS
      Returns:
      A future for the delete
